channel.title: math.SG updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.SG updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Morita equivalence of shifted symplectic Lie n-groupoids
item.description: arXiv:2505.24018v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: Symplectic structures on higher objects like Lie groupoids have been studied for some time now, but not all of the proposed definitions are preserved under Morita equivalence of Lie groupoids, in turn giving rise to a consistent notion of symplectic stacks. Recently, this concept has been generalized to m-shifted symplectic forms on Lie n-groupoids, which are indeed preserved under Morita equivalence of Lie n-groupoids. In this paper, we give a rigorous proof for this statement.
item.dc:creator: Milena Weiershausen

item.title: Wild Betti sheaves
item.description: arXiv:2505.24599v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: In this note, we consider the problem of constructing an enlargement of the category of Betti sheaves that supports an ``exponential local system'' on $\mathbb R$, and a Fourier equivalence defined on all sheaves. We show that there is a universal solution, recovering a construction of Tamarkin known also as ``enhanced sheaves''. The universality property implies that the category of coefficients of this theory is, in a suitable sense, a nontrivial $\mathbb R_{>0}$-torsor over $\mathrm{Spec}(\mathbb Z)$.
item.dc:creator: Peter Scholze

item.title: Classification of almost abelian Lie groups admitting left-invariant complex or symplectic structures
item.description: arXiv:2406.06819v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We classify the almost abelian Lie algebras $\mathfrak g_A=\mathbb R e_0 \ltimes_A \mathbb R^{2n-1}$ admitting complex or symplectic structures. The matrix $A\in M(2n-1,\mathbb R )$ encodes the adjoint action of $e_0$ on the abelian ideal $\mathbb R^{2n-1}$, and the existence of complex or symplectic structures on $\mathfrak g_A$ imposes restrictions on the Jordan normal form of $A$. The classification essentially reduces to the case when $A$ is nilpotent, so we start by considering this case. It turns out that if $A$ is nilpotent and $\mathfrak g_A$ admits a complex structure, then $\mathfrak g_A$ necessarily admits a symplectic structure. This is not true in general when $A$ is non-nilpotent. Finally, several consequences of the classification theorems are obtained.
item.dc:creator: Romina M. Arroyo, Mar\'ia L. Barberis, Ver\'onica S. Diaz, Yamile Godoy, Isabel Hern\'andez
